misdeed: A series of accidents and misfortunes has plagued a lakeside village, culminating in the disappearance of a young musician. The villagers whisper of a haunting melody that lures people to the lake, never to return.
solution: The Vaesen is the Neck and can be banished by luring him to a place surrounded by Christian symbols and iron.

clues.description: The accidents often involve water: boats capsizing, people falling into wells, and even an unfortunate incident with a bathhouse.
The villagers report hearing a beautiful, yet unsettling melody drifting across the lake, particularly at night.
Fish, once plentiful in the lake, have become scarce, and those caught are often deformed or bear strange markings.
A silver locket, engraved with a musical note and containing a lock of the missing musician's hair, is found by the lakeâ€™s edge.
Local legends speak of a water spirit who plays a silver flute, luring those who hear its music to a watery grave.
An old fisherman claims to have seen a figure with glowing eyes and webbed fingers playing a flute beneath the surface of the lake.

plotTwist.description: A grieving mother, seeking to reunite with her drowned child, unknowingly made a deal with the Vaesen, offering her voice in exchange for a glimpse of her lost son.
